intro: Senecio stoechadiformis, commonly known as the Stoechadis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
